comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: It was the unveiling of the new statue of Queen Victoria as part of the Centenary celebrations on Tuesday 24 January 1888. Read all about it - SMH 26/1/1888 p.5 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/page/1391390 Henry King was also there, somewhere on the right with a black cloth over his head ... [http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2363499144/]

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] I'm thinking that one was a bit easy, huh :)
It's a great photo, all that bustle and movement has been captured, it must have been an exciting day..
Thanks for the info - we'll update the caption.
AB

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] Never too easy - just that I have been there before with the Henry King photo.   I remember three years ago having huge problems trying to find what the occasion was (when Trove was young).
